alert.note: Alert for East Central Plains (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Fire Weather Watch issued February 15 at 2:33AM MST until February 16 at 6:00PM MST by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...RED FLAG WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 11 AM TO 6 PM MST TODAY FOR AREAS ALONG AND EAST OF I-25 AND ALONG AND SOUTH OF I-40 EXCLUDING THE RIO GRANDE VALLEY DUE TO STRONG WINDS...LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITY...ABOVE AVERAGE TEMPERATURES AND AN UNSTABLE AIRMASS... ...FIRE WEATHER WATCH IN EFFECT FROM WEDNESDAY MORNING THROUGH WEDNESDAY AFTERNOON FOR THE EAST CENTRAL PLAINS... .Above average temperatures will combine with strong southwest winds, very low relative humidity, and an unstable airmass to generate critical fire weather conditions mainly along and south of I-40 and along and east of I-25 excluding the Rio Grande Valley below any significant snowpack today. Strong southwest winds will continue through tonight into Wednesday across portions of the eastern plains. A Fire Weather Watch is in effect Wednesday for the east-central plains mainly east of the Pecos River. ...RED FLAG WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 11 AM THIS MORNING TO 6 PM MST THIS EVENING... ...FIRE WEATHER WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM WEDNESDAY MORNING THROUGH WEDNESDAY AFTERNOON... * AREA AND TIMING...East-central plains from late this morning through late this afternoon as well as late Wednesday morning through late Wednesday afternoon. * 20 FOOT WINDS...Southwest 20-30 mph with gusts to around 40 mph this afternoon and southwest 25 to 35 mph with gusts to around 45 mph Wednesday afternoon. * RELATIVE HUMIDITY...Ranging from 5 to 9 percent this afternoon and 10 to 15 percent Wednesday afternoon. * IMPACTS...Any fires that develop will likely spread rapidly. Outdoor burning is not recommended.
info.instruction: Please advise the appropriate officials or fire crews in the field of this Red Flag Warning. Please advise the appropriate officials or fire crews in the field of this Fire Weather Watch.
